s2.name: Project Description

p.strong: MIND is an implementation of the Fractal component model for the development of embedded software.

s2.p:
The core project provides:
Mindc, an architecture compilation tool-chain
MindEd, an Eclipse CDT-based Integrated Development Environment (with ADL and ITF editors)
A basic components library
The mind-tools all-in-one package provides additional tools and plugins:
An Optimization backend to generate smaller and faster code
A simple stylesheet system (global-extensions) for non-intrusive annotations propagation
A GraphViz' Dot (.gv) generator for architectural visualization (click to navigate, and opens source elements in Eclipse)
Mindot viewer for the generated .gv files (requires Python 2.7, PyGTK-all-in-one 2.24.0, GraphViz >= 2.28)
MindUnit, a unit tests framework / frontend (requires CUnit 2.1-2, source delivered "as is" with the examples)
IAR compiler/linker family support (CLI wrapper plugin)
VxWorks Diab compiler/linker family support (CLI wrapper plugin)
MindC++ for C++ support and generation (using a simple component-class mapping)
Binutils-based Dependency Tools for Design Structure Matrices (DSM) generation and link-time Bindings by-passing detection
Generic third-party compiler support helpers
Latest MindEd-ready examples
Mind Visual Diff for temporal and structural architecture comparison (open dot/gv output with Mindot Viewer)
Simple C Macro Generator for static code analysis (Klocwork, Scanbuild...) and improved Eclipse C support
JSON Generator serializing architecture in a d3.js-friendly format for modern visualization (see d3js.org)
Tools documentation
